Artur Jesslen

Ph.D. Student
University of Freiburg
jesslen@cs.uni-freiburg.de


About Me

I am currently a first-year Ph.D. student at the University of Freiburg. I am part of the Generative Vision and Robust Learning group, lead by Adam Kortylewski He assisted the development of the OOD-CV benchmark with a focus on the robustness of state-of-the-art classification and pose estimation methods. His research interests include robust vision, generative models, and scene understanding.

Research Interests

  • Computer Vision: robust vision, image recognition, pose estimation, 3D reconstruction, generative learning
  • Machine Learning: contrastive learning, incremental learning

News

[May, 2023] I will attend the Generative Modeling Summer School (GeMSS) in Copenhagen, June 26th to 30th.
[Mar, 2023] I will be part of the organization of the 2nd Workshop on Out Of Distribution Generalization in Computer Vision at ICCV 2023.
[Jul, 2022] I will start a Ph.D. at the University of Freiburg as part of the Generative Vision and Robust Learning group and the Computer Vision group.
